Title.evidence: Title: SAPTAP Trial: A Randomised Controlled Trial

Trial_Design.evidence: This multicentre, non-inferiority randomised controlled trial (RCT)

Participants.evidence: Participants were adults with symptomatic chronic venous disease, recruited from seven medical centres in the Netherlands.

Objective.evidence: aimed to determine if single ambulatory phlebectomy with or without delayed endovenous truncal ablation (SAP) is non-inferior to thermal endovenous ablation with concomitant phlebectomy (TAP)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the VEINES-QOL/Sym score at 12 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: randomised to SAP or TAP using an automated service, with allocation concealment.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding was not feasible for patients or clinicians.

Number_Randomised.evidence: Between January 2015 and December 2018, 464 patients were randomised (SAP 227, TAP 237).

Result_Outcome.evidence: VEINES-QOL scores were 52.7 (95% CI 51.9 to 53.9) for SAP and 53.8 (53.3 to 55.1) for TAP.

Harms.evidence: Adverse events were minor and similar between groups.

Funding.evidence: Funding: Supported by Erasmus Medical Centre Rotterdam.
